result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel D Bulow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant, Samuel D Bulow with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Holly D. Wood Webster.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(2:39)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Rivard - agreement - plea to 15CM69 Ct 1 - dismiss Ct 2 & 15CM68, dismissed and read-in - w/held sent 1 yr prob - 10 days jail - complete any counseling/treatment/psych eval - cc
Deft - 15CM69 Ct 1 pleads no contest - waives rights & JT
Parties stipulate to facts
State - no response from any victims in either case

COURT:  15CM69 Ct 1 - plea voluntary - finds deft guilty
w/held sentence 1 yr prob
$243 cc
$200 dna surchg        ($500 cash bond applies)
  CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
10 days jail - huber allowed - report by June 5, 2015 at 5 p.m.
complete any counseling/treatment/any programming requested by agent
No credit

DISMISS:  15CM69 Ct 2
DISMISS & READ-IN:  15CM68

  Deft waives reading & speedy trial
